Subject: ...and a question on innovation implementation
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=175530192; y=k7yUiPhLcUe2u2supBKeAEw6RsHSHuMW0Fc7Nc2y2iz9TpjJ

By definition, innovation is an ephemeral thing. It's very existence is
its own nemesis. So if you reward for innovation, what is there to
prevent the innovative streak, or the behaviour that was innovated, from
being mutated away in future generations. As once the reward has been
given for innovation, that behaviour ceases to earn a reward?

Rob Marsden
